channel.title: Tax on stuff from amazon
channel.description:
I am planning to buy a new graphics card for my PC from amazon that costs 340$ ( 500$ here , lol.. ) which is going to save me A LOT. The item does ship to my location from the US but amazon shows that i will have to pay 66$ as import fees or tax upon purchase for a total of 430$ ( still cheaper ) , So my question is .. Is it possible for me to get away from paying the tax amount? I usually tell sellers on my online purchases to declare on package low price to avoid tax , but here i'm buying from MSI directly so i doubt that they would "lie" for me. And what's even worse if i had to pay tax for the taxed amount too when the card arrives to customs in here , fudging me over twice. But if i buy from other sellers will they be willing to help me or there is no escape?
Help appreciated if you have any experience with this stuff.
Thanks!

item.title: Tax on stuff from amazon
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

^ he isn’t paying for it twice.

he is paying Amazon and Amazon is paying for it

http://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?nodeId=201119100
http://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html/?nodeId=201117970

Read full topic

item.title: Tax on stuff from amazon
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Check up your country’s customs law yourself. There should be a way to avoid paying the tax for it twice. Import laws vary a lot from country to country and where you import it from.

Read full topic

item.title: Tax on stuff from amazon
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

well that’s not too bad , it will cost a bit more but still a better price than here , thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: Tax on stuff from amazon
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

when shipping to outside countries that have customs checks and whatnot, users/companies have to pay the fee themselves. they’re not going to pay the fee and not charge you for it.

if they pay more than what Amazon charged you, you aren’t billed. if they pay less than what Amazon charged you, you’re refunded the difference.

however you cannot escape this as its customs. and international shipping

Read full topic
